content.description:
Hit The Slit ascends perfect incut edges on a slightly overhung face.

Stand start with a paired of stacked edges about six feet off the deck. From there, hit a sidepull with the right, crank up to a sloper/edge (crux) with the left hand, bump the right up to a good incut edge, then finish the remainder with either a big move to the lip, or work the small edges, and top it out.
content.protection: Two pads should work just fine, the landing is good, but there is a small tree in the landing.
content.location: It ascends the south face of Sillage Rock.

content.description:
Beta Blocker ascends an overhanging, lowball dihedral.

Sit start with a left hand on a big sloper shelf, a right hand on big sidepull/undercling, and a high right heel hook. From there, crank up to a right hand edge/pinch on the arete (crux?), match a left hand, hit the lip, and top it out.
content.protection: The problem is definitely a lowball, but there is a bad rock behind the problem. I would recommend at least two pads.
content.location: It ascends the west face dihedral.
